str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A gate. Apparently a primary word; a gate, i.e. The leaf or wing of a folding entrance.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From hagios; to make holy, i.e. purify or consecrate; to venerate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
